property.propremark: Motor Parameter: Proportional gain in the PI-parts of the current controller.
Motor Parameter: Integral gain in the PI-parts of the current controller.
Maximum allowed torque current during forward acceleration.
Maximum allowed torque current during reverse acceleration.
The maximum allowed change during 1 ms (i.e. derivate) of the Torque Current that is allowed. A too high derivate may for example introduce noise in the gear.
Maximum allowed torque current during forward braking/deceleration.
Maximum allowed torque current during reverse braking/deceleration.
Proportional gain in the PI-parts of the speed controller.
Integral gain in the PI-parts of the speed controller.
Current limit for supervision. Supervision is enabled when the requested torque current goes above this limit. (Regulator supervision 0x6210)
Delay before safe state in absence of movement in correct direction. 0 = Disable. (Regulator supervision 0x6210)
Steering Encoder Scale
Steering Encoder Offset (Position of Sync pulse)
Proportional gain in the PI-parts of the position controller.
Integral gain in the PI-parts of the position controller.
Max motor speed as output from position controller and input to speed controller. VoltageFeedback: 1024 = 48V, Otherwise: 16384 = 90 deg/s
Wheel Angle Limit. 0 = No Limit
Speed limited zone approaching MaxWheelAngle.
Speed limit for the slow down zone.
Polarity of end limit switch. Default is active high.
Set true to allow sync. Set to false to reject unwanted sync pulse in multi turn application.
Window where we expect sync pulse to appear
Encoder Sync Emergency. 0 = Sync Emergency disabled. OBS! Disabling the sync emergency can be a serious safety issue!
Set true to reverse encoder direction. Same effect as swapping A and B signals.
Set true to use motor voltage as speed feedback instead of encoder. (Speed scale: 1024 = 48 V)
Current to compensate for friction. Added to speed regulator output with sign depending on the command speed.
Ready To Switch On (Dc bus is charged)
Switched On
Power Stage Enabled
Switch On Disabled (Dc bus voltage to low, charging timeout)
Wheel Angle
Digital Input 2 value, encoder sync, pin 14
Digital Input 3 value, end limit switch, pin 13
Switch On
Enable Power Stage
Set Angle
Digital Output 1 value, pin 2
Digital Output 2 value, pin 18
Digital Output 3 value, pin 21
Digital Output 4 value, pin 22
Runtime voltage measurement on the B+ input
Output from speed controller, input to current controller.
Actual torque current in current controller.
Bit0 - Sync Valid. Set when first sync pulse inside the sync window has been detected
Number of pulse edges captured.
Counter for sync pulses detected outside sync window. Valid after first sync pulse inside the sync window has been detected
Counter for expected but not present sync pulses inside sync window. Valid after first sync pulse inside the sync window has been detected
Temperature of the heatsink
Extended Warnings set by the drive, valid when Warning bit is set
Extended Errors set by the drive, valid when Error bit is set
Timer counting absence of movement in correct direction. See: Reg Supervision Failure Delay
Max value of Reg Supervision Timer since power on.
CAN bus ID
CAN node ID
0 = Background, the background programs takes action when an error occur in the device. 1 = PLC, no action from background program. The error should be handled by the PLC application.
Decides if the device will start up in safe state.
The current CANopen state of the device.
The current size of the client SDO buffer (read/write SDO's from the vehicle controller to this device).
